alert.note: Alert for Red River (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 8:19AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern McCurtain and northwestern Red River Counties through 915 AM CDT... At 819 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fanshawe to near Snow to 8 miles northeast of Boswell. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wright City, Valliant, Millerton, Rufe, Smithville, Battiest, Pickens, Mount Herman, Sherwood, Redland, Kanawha, Glover, Kiomatia, Slim, Bethel, Ringold and Golden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
